entities.name: Strict Schedule
entities.description: A strict schedule ensures that all necessary tasks are completed on time, maintaining the health and well-being of the crew and the proper functioning of the space station.

entities.name: Evening
entities.description: The evening is the latter part of the day, typically after work or school hours and before bedtime.

entities.name: daily work assignments
entities.description: Scheduled activities and responsibilities performed by astronauts on a daily basis.

entities.name: SCIENTIFIC EXPERIMENTS
entities.description: Research activities conducted by astronauts to advance knowledge in various scientific fields

entities.name: perspective
entities.description: A perspective is an outlook or way of looking at something.

entities.name: universe
entities.description: The infinite expanse of space and time containing everything that exists.

entities.name: Crew Well-Being
entities.description: The overall physical and mental health of the crew members.

entities.name: exercise
entities.description: A routine of movements designed to maintain health and prevent physical degradation.

entities.name: muscle and bone loss
entities.description: Muscle and bone loss refers to the reduction in muscle mass and density of bones due to lack of gravitational forces, impacting astronauts' health during prolonged space missions.

entities.name: issues that may have arisen overnight
entities.description: Problems or concerns that occurred while the astronauts were sleeping.

entities.name: human knowledge
entities.description: The unknown or unexplored part of science and discovery.

entities.name: walls
entities.description: The walls are solid and serve as support structures within the sleeping quarters.

entities.name: EARTH
entities.description: The planet that astronauts observe and study from space, providing a unique perspective on its beauty and complexity

entities.name: mental well-being
entities.description: Mental well-being refers to the state of being comfortable, healthy, and happy. It is an important aspect of overall health and quality of life.

attributes.Importance in Space Missions: Crucial for maintaining morale during long-duration space missions

entities.name: living quarters
entities.description: The living quarters are areas within the space station where astronauts reside and perform daily activities.

entities.name: Microgravity
entities.description: Microgravity is a condition where gravity is so weak that it has little effect on objects, such as in space.

entities.name: space
entities.description: Space is the vast, nearly empty expanse that exists beyond Earth"s atmosphere. It is characterized by its extreme conditions and unique challenges for human habitation and exploration.

attributes.Characteristics: Vast, nearly empty expanse; extreme conditions

entities.name: Downtime
entities.description: Periods of rest and relaxation that are essential for mental health.

entities.name: profession
entities.description: The profession of studying celestial objects and phenomena.

entities.name: space exploration
entities.description: The pursuit and advancement into outer space.

entities.name: MISSION CONTROL
entities.description: The ground-based team responsible for monitoring and directing the activities of astronauts and spacecraft in space

entities.name: human body
entities.description: The human body is the entire structure of a human being, composed of various systems and organs that work together to maintain life.

attributes.Physical Fitness Requirement: High level of physical fitness required for astronauts

entities.name: breakfast
entities.description: A morning meal typically consumed by individuals together.

entities.name: Living and Working Conditions
entities.description: The conditions in space are extreme, including microgravity, radiation exposure, and isolation. These conditions present numerous challenges for human habitation and exploration.

entities.name: Bone Loss
entities.description: A condition where the bones lose density and strength, often due to lack of gravitational stress.

entities.name: personal reflection
entities.description: The introspective process where astronauts contemplate their experiences, emotions, and goals during space missions.

entities.name: day"s activities
entities.description: Tasks that need to be completed during the day, including scientific experiments and maintenance work.

entities.name: FINAL CHECK-IN
entities.description: An evening meeting with mission control to report on the day's activities and receive instructions for the next day

entities.name: EXERCISE REGIMEN
entities.description: A structured program of physical activity designed to maintain astronauts' health in microgravity

entities.name: Future Generations
entities.description: Future generations refer to the people who will inherit the knowledge and advancements made through space exploration.

entities.name: MORNING BRIEFING
entities.description: A morning session where crew members discuss daily tasks, receive updates and address issues.

entities.name: wonders
entities.description: Stunning natural occurrences observed in space.

entities.name: MEALS AND RELAXATION
entities.description: Scheduled breaks for astronauts to eat, socialize, and relax, which are important for maintaining morale and mental well-being

entities.name: new instructions from mission control
entities.description: Instructions and updates provided by mission control to guide the astronauts" activities.

entities.name: ASTRONAUT
entities.description: A professional who travels in space, conducting scientific experiments, maintenance work, and other tasks on a space station

entities.name: proper functioning of the space station
entities.description: The proper functioning of the space station is critical for the success of space missions.

entities.name: Unique Experiences
entities.description: Living in space offers rare and extraordinary experiences, such as viewing Earth from a distance, conducting experiments in microgravity, and experiencing the vastness of the universe.

entities.name: discovery
entities.description: The advancement of knowledge through research and experimentation.

entities.name: daily activities
entities.description: The daily activities of an astronaut include a wide range of tasks such as scientific research, physical exertion, and personal reflection.

entities.name: exploration
entities.description: The act of discovering and studying new areas or regions, particularly in astronomy.
